title: storage: remove_graph
body:
Remove graph from storage based on the graph ID.
For mem storage, remove the graph from the map to remove it from memory.
For linear storage, remove the graph file from the filesystem.

Test scenario:
- A creates a graph
- B syncs with A (to get the graph from A)
- Graphs A & B match
- B locally adds a command to graph
- Graphs A & B no longer match
- B deletes graph
- B syncs with A (to get graph again from A)
- Graphs A & B match again

title: Create status page
body: Provides an easy way to check crates.io and docs.rs status.

title: release: bump crate versions needed for aqc release
body: Bump crate versions to release aranya-core crates needed by the upcoming AQC release.

title: crypto: impl `Hash` for `CipherSuiteId` and rename serde repr
capi-core: fix `Opaque` use-after-free
body: Also make `into_inner` `pub`.

title: aranya-crypto: clean up dependencies
body:
We were importing both postcard and ciborium, which was overkill. Choose ciborium since CBOR is a standard and postcard is "just" some library.

This also lets us get rid of `MaxSize`, which we didn't really use. That will help us get rid of some duplicate dependencies in later PRs.

title: Use errno crate
body: Note it was already in our dependency tree. https://crates.io/crates/errno

title: policy-compiler: box error and refactor tests
body: The error was rather large, see https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#result_large_err.

title: Close #115: Support enums in ffi
chore: rolling release
body: Fixes #242

title: policy-compiler: remove unused items
body: These are unused. Removing unless there are any objections.

title: capi: make opaque types an exact size and alignment
body:
The opaque macro now serves two functions. It first wraps the original type in the `Opaque` wrapper. Then it applies the `[u8; SIZE]` representation to the generated renamed type that cbindgen sees.

Closes #227.

title: crypto: pair PSKs with cipher suites
body: Fixes #237

title: capi-core: remove `Safe` `Alias` impl
body: I think it was meant to be `Alias<Safe<U>> for Safe<T>`, but that also seems not very useful since the type ID will presumably mismatch? I am just removing it for now since it is not needed.

title: chore: Rolling Release 2025-04-21
body: Creates a new release with the latest aranya-core changes. The two main changes are allowing for listing Graph IDs, and struct subselection support.

title: Close #194: Allow enums in key values.
Switch to 32 byte IDs
body: Note from @elagergren-spideroak: We chose 512 bit IDs long before NIST’s PQ guidance (flow2, perhaps even flow1). 512 bit IDs don’t provide a meaningful improvement in collision resistance over 256 bit IDs, but they do have a negative performance impact. So, make the switch before MVP.

title: (capi-codegen) Restrict return types
body:
Closes #209

- Add the `deny(improper_ctypes*)`attribute  to `extern "C"` functions
- When a value is directly returned from an `extern "C"` function, check that the value implements `aranya-capi-core::types::Output`

title: Fix #168: Make sure function return types are actually defined.
chore: fix vet config and remove unused path dep versions
body:
Fixes `cargo vet` check: https://github.com/aranya-project/aranya-core/actions/runs/14389133920/job/40351787630

Removes `version` from `path` dependencies in crates that have not been published and from `dev-dependencies`.

title: aqc: release crypto & ffi crates
body:
Release AQC crypto & ffi crates.

Generated this PR with:
`release-plz update`

There's a good chance there could be breaking changes that weren't caught by the tool.

AQC crypto & ffi PR where changes are that are being released (plus whatever else changed on the `main` branch since the last release):
https://github.com/aranya-project/aranya-core/pull/184

title: Expose Graph IDs via StorageProvider
body: Adds a new method to StorageProvider and IoManager to allow listing existing Graph IDs. This includes implementing `fdopendir`, `readdir`, and `closedir` methods in `aranya-libc`.

body: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2025-0023

title: (capi-codegen) Enum return types
body:
Closes #160

## Changes
- Convert to a "FFI enum" using it's `From` impl when a trampoline function returns the underlying enum type
- When there's an output param, try to convert to a "FFI enum" from it's underlying type by calling `Into::into`
- Add `ByMutPtr` impl for "FFI enums"

title: fix: make linear storage checksum more portable
aqc: implement aranya-crypto support, FFI, handler

Fixes #183
Fixes #181

title: aranya-capi-codegen: Apply `#[cfg()]` Attributes To FFI Wrapper
body: Since we're making AFC experimental, some types are now conditionally defined, which causes errors in our FFI wrapper since the type path doesn't exist. This should fix that by copying the same `#[cfg()]` flags over.

body: Diff is noisy due to moving code but the braid algorithm didn't change, I just check to make sure there are never two finalize commands in the strand heap. Closes #108.

title: Update syntax for "Some" optional literals
body:
Resolves #125

Inner expression for "Some" optional literals must be wrapped with parentheses

title: runtime: convert some `bug!`s to regular errors
body: These errors are reasonably reachable and recoverable so they should be normal errors.

title: Security updates
body:
- Update `rcgen` and use aws crypto for it and `s2n-quic` instead of `ring`
  - `ring`'s https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2025-0009 required updating `rcgen`, which now has a flag for choosing aws crypto, so I switched off `ring` entirely.
- Update `scc` and `sdd` off yanked versions.
- Allow https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2024-0436.html
  - it doesn't seem problematic and has no easy migration at the moment.

title: Add struct subselection
body:
Resolves #117

## Changes
- Adds new Instructions for getting and setting multiple fields in a struct, see https://github.com/aranya-project/aranya-core/pull/120#discussion_r1987959649
- New `aranya_policy_ast::Expression:` variant -> `aranya_policy_ast::Expression::Substruct`

title: Close #110: Add match expressions.
Close #103: `if`, `match` statements now limit scope to their blocks.
body: Close #103: Variables defined in `if` and `match` blocks are now scoped to the blocks.

title: More type checking
body: Closes #14

title: Close #18: Switch policy lang support to V2.
body: Policy language version 1 is now deprecated, and the parser will error out if it encounters it. Going forward, use `policy-version: 2` in the front matter of policy `.md` files.

title: Add `@generated` tag to code generators
body:
See <https://generated.at>.

I have not removed any `#[rustfmt::skip]` because then `cargo +stable fmt` would still change the generated files.

Thanks @nikki-aranya for finding this.

title: Describe repo contents in README
body:
Adds a high-level description of what is included in this repository. 

Also, adds a `Maintainers` section and rearranges the contributing section to be next to this addition (matching the format of the aranya repo: https://github.com/aranya-project/aranya/pull/39).

title: Close #73: Change enum representation to be orderable
body: Enum values are now stored as `Vec<usize>`s in the VM.

title: crypto: remove ciphersuite ID
body:
Updates #23
Updates #22

title: Implement Block Expressions
body:
Block expressions can contain some statements before a final expression, which the block as a whole evaluates to.

```
let x = {
    let y = 1
    : y + 2
}
check x == 3
```

Closes #90

title: Remove limit on session command
body: This is more consistent since we don't currently limit the command size anywhere else. We may want to handle session commands differently anyways. Limiting will later be handled by #84.

title: Add link to public docs site
Fix git-unchanged check and fix lockfile
body: `cargo-make` uses `sh` by default, which accepts bash-isms on our Mac dev machines, but not in CI. Since the problem was in an `if`, it just got always skipped from `[[ not found`.

title: Migrate Errors to `thiserror`
body: Migrates the majority of errors to `thiserror`, save for the places where it doesn't make sense (mostly more complex ErrorKind-type errors and macros). Solves #71.

title: rm release-plz pr
body: The `release-plz` PR is unable to update crate versions correctly when there are complex dependency trees with newer versions. We'll need to update crate versions in a PR manually for now until we can add the needed functionality to the tooling.

Automates crates.io publishing and release PR creation.

title: crypto: move low level crypto into `aranya-crypto-core`
body:
This PR attempts to keep `aranya-crypto`'s APIs the same by re-exporting types, etc. Future PRs will start to pare back `aranya-crypto`.

Fixes #33

title: #15: Publish multiple commands
body:
- The VM now `Yield`s to the  runtime when it publishes a command. The runtime is responsible for sealing the command, updating the facts database, then resuming the VM so it can process the next command.
- FFI `call`s now take an immutable self.
